alert.note: Alert for Benewah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 01 at 9:06PM MST until further notice by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Idaho... St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Washington...Idaho... Palouse River near Potlatch affecting Latah and Whitman Counties. .Steady rains will move back into North Idaho and Southeastern Washington overnight and continue on and off through Thursday. Rainfall amounts over the next 48 hours could be upwards of an inch. Mild temperatures and ripening midlevel snowpack will contribute runoff into the river basins. For the Palouse River...including Potlatch...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...St Joe River at St Maries. * WHEN...From Thursday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 33.0 feet, Water may be over St Joe City Road. At 35.0 feet, Water will be up to Aqua Avenue in St Maries. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 27.0 feet. - The river is steadily rising. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 32.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning.Wednesday morning at 1000 AM PST.
